website_summaries.verdict: This officially licensed Xbox One remote works as well as the Microsoft model, at a much lower price.
pros: With more buttons and functions than most competing models, including the Microsoft model, this is a powerful little remote and is one of the cheapest available
Uses an IR signal and doesn't need to be paired with your Xbox One
Features a few standard Xbox One buttons and includes 2 AAA batteries
cons: The IR can be unreliable, and the rubber coating may peel off over time

customer_reviews.title: A big step up from the official Xbox one remote.
customer_reviews.text: This should be the official remote for Xbox one. It has the same feel as the official one with additional functionality. The best part is, it does not nead direct line of sight to work! I was sceptical about buying this remote because some of the reviews said that the volume controls don't work. I haven't had any issues with volume or any other buttons for that matter, so it might vary for individual set ups. I highly recommend this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Volume button issue FIXED
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot of reviewers complain that the remote works perfectly except for the volume button. I have found that when you point the remote directly at the TV the volume basically never works. HOWEVER, if you point the remote about halfway (45°) either up or down, the volume works almost flawlessly. (feels like it works best when pointing the remote up) I'm not sure if it's related to why I have the volume issues in the first place, but I use a Vizio sound bar setup. So I'm not sure if people using just TV speakers don't have any issues with the remote. Otherwise, the remote works great!
customer_reviews.author: MovieGoer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent XBox One remote
customer_reviews.text: This is the best remote I have used for the Xbox One. The standard smaller remote that is produced by Xbox is good but it does not have as many functional buttons as this remote. If you are watching a streaming service through your Xbox, this remote is the best option out there. I don't use it with a DVR and I have heard some customers have trouble controlling their devices with it. For my purposes it works perfectly and controls my TV as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Underwood

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for a month or two the rubber coating started pealing off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Archambeau

customer_reviews.title: Volume button issues. IR interference.
customer_reviews.text: When you want xBox to control an IR controlled amplifier the signal from the remote interferes with the signal from the Xbox IR blaster. The only way around it is to put the amplifier in the cabinet with an IR extender leading from the Xbox into it. Or you can get the Bluetooth remote from Microsoft. I am going to try to fashion a solution. But I may just give up and spend the money. Unless these guys make a Bluetooth version (which would be pricier) there may not be a solution to this.
customer_reviews.author: William OHara

customer_reviews.title: The IR sucks and has to be pointed perfectly to work.
customer_reviews.text: This remote looks and feels ok, but the range is awful! I have to constantly try to aim the IR perfectly at the Xbox so it will register a command. Most of the time I'm clicking the button over and over again because the IR doesn't register, it has to be pointed just right. I wish I bought another remote.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: The setup was quick and easy via Settings -> TV & OneGuide -> Device Control ...
customer_reviews.text: Controller works out of the box with the Xbox One. I ended up getting 1 TNP IR Emitter Cable to be able to turn up/down the volume, change channel and even turn off the TV when I turn of the Xbox. The setup was quick and easy via Settings -> TV & OneGuide -> Device Control -> TV Setup once the IR Emitter where properly placed on the IR receiver of the TV. Anyone can just pick up the controller and start watching some Hulu Live TV when not playing video games.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a cheaper remote and this one to test out. Worth the extra $12 compared to the other more compacted remote. Love the backlit feature of the remote when you pick it up or move the unit. Finish and feel of the remote is spot on. Going to order another one if I find a good deal for an Xbox One S. Used it as a media center for YouTube TV, Netflix and Kodi. A definite cable cutter option.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Gamble...
customer_reviews.text: Very, very disappointed. This is my second one of these remotes. The first one wore out in a year, but I still would have given it three stars, maybe even four. Buttons like these do lose their contacts eventually. The second one I purchased has been HORRIBLE since day one. At least a third of the buttons only make partial contact. They do work, sort of, but they require multiple pushes to find just the right spot. Unfortunately, I have had this for a month or two and disposed of the packaging. I suppose I am stuck with it until I can find an alternative to buy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Metz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Remote Control for Xbox one.
customer_reviews.text: This remote control is awesome. When using the controller as a remote control you have to turn it back on to use it after about 5 minutes or so. I also like the fact that when you pick it up the buttons are all backlit with a blue light that lights up for a couple seconds every time you pick it up. So if you are in a dark room or like me, I usually watch hulu, netflix or prime video while laying in bed late at night with all the lights off so this backlit feature is very helpful. The setup was extremely easy as well. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this r/c.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote, but somehow doesn't work with Amazon Prime Video
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this in the Talon Remote's fault or Amazon's (I think it's Amazon's fault for a crappy app), but with Amazon Prime Video, the only way to fast forward and rewind is to ignore the fast forward and rewind buttons, and instead navigate like it's a controller, pressing select, then press left, right, up, down and select again. Pretty much defeats the point of using a dedicated media remote. However, I'm pretty sure this is Amazon's fault, not the remote's, because the dedicated fast forward, remind, etc. work fine with Microsoft Movies & TV app.
customer_reviews.author: GraniteStateColin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Kinect and media device setup. I have my Kinect programmed to turn on and off my TV and receiver. Receiver responds to volume controls and Xbox turns on and off with this controller. Happy with it. EDIT: After using it for several months, have noticed that volume buttons are too close together so that when you press down, it also presses up and cancels out the command. I can get it to work if I'm careful how I press the button, but it's a pain, and other people who try to use it don't get it. Wish the volume buttons were placed farther away to avoid this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this earlier?
customer_reviews.text: This is the most convenient thing ever if you watch movies/shows on the Xbox. Works seamlessly and does the job for Netflix, Vudu, and Fandango (those are pretty much all I use for watching shows). I love how you can set it up to be able to turn the TV and Xbox on/off together, that’s makes it really nice. I highly recommend getting this. It makes it so much easier than having to fiddle with the controller every time
customer_reviews.author: Cody Moore

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: This remote does the job. Just like other people mentioned, its a line of sight remote which is a little annoying but you can expect much with anything related to microsoft. (Yes, I said it.) My only real gripe is the battery cover design. The whole back of the remote comes off to change the batteries and with mine, it immediately started to slide off every time I picked it up. A little black duct tape on the sides fixed the problem but just annoying. I'm actually ordering a new one today since mine just stopped working after a little over 2 years but it was only 15 dollars so I'm not complaining. Much..
customer_reviews.author: Coheed

customer_reviews.title: So much better for watching movies
customer_reviews.text: Much better than using gaming controller for watching streaming movies. Mostly because if you breathe in the direction of the gaming controller or your cat walks over it on the couch while watching a movie it would fast forward or rewind unpredictably and it is nearly impossible to scan back to the correct spot in the movie accurately with the clumsiness of the thumb stick controls. It got to the point where I would just shut off the gaming controller to avoid this headache. Four stars instead of five because the remote is nicely backlit except mysteriously for the ABXY buttons. Otherwise I would recommend this as an indispensable purchase for anyone who streams movies regularly on XBOX One.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Metal Fan

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd Bought This Sooner!
customer_reviews.text: My XBONE has some odd issue where the controllers loose connectivity constantly. It's infuriating, so I solved it by going old school and use a USB cord. No batteries and no loss of connection! However, huge tripping hazard!!! Well the ole XBONE has become the VCR for me and we use it primarily to watch Hulu, Disney+, and Amazon shows. So the trip hazard had to go, enter this remote! I wish I'd bought it sooner and will get one for any and all future consoles! Works great and is simple to use! So simple, anyone who can use VCR should be able to use this!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: There's one annoying problem
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote (mostly)! I wanted a remote that would also control sound from my Pioneer receiver when I watch movies/TV series using various apps on Xbox. It does this and everything else as promised in the Amazon description for a very reasonable price. There is one drawback: the arrow keys lack tactile differentiation from the center enter button. You think you are pushing the arrow key and you end up pushing the enter button. Most remotes have raised arrow key functions but this uses a "flat face" design; hence the problem. A very good remote but 4 not 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J.

customer_reviews.title: Sit directly in front of your Xbox and invest in Duracell
customer_reviews.text: It works instantly for watching movies and TV shows. Much quicker then turning on and waiting for the controller to link. That being said...Not the best implementation of a remote. Very limited useable angle, although more likely it has to do with the tech used. Need to have it level with the console and at no more than 45 degrees in any direction. Eats batteries for lunch. If there was a way to disable the backlight effects that turn on every time the thing is barely moved, it probably wouldn't be such a battery hog. If you can deal with that, then it's not a deal breaker. For me, it's almost easier to use the controller.
customer_reviews.author: LiCKQuiD

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great! The grippy back and the fact that its ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! The grippy back and the fact that its back lit upon lifting it up is awesome. Navigating my xbox one to watch Netflix, HBO, and Amazaon has never been easier. No more battery drain on my controllers! No more frustrating scowls by the missus on how she 'hates using that clunky thing' (in reference to the controller). One draw back i had is the fact that i couldn't get the volume buttons configured for my super hi-tech Hisense TV, but i think that is more an XBOX One thing and not the remotes fault. This is the remote to own.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What a great controller!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this controller sooner! It has a soft touch coating that feels great in the hand. Most of the buttons are backlit and activates when you pick it up. It's so much better than using the regular Xbox controller. When using the Xbox controller, if you use it wirelessly, you have to deal with turning it back on after the auto shut off feature and if you don't want to turning off, you have to have it plugged in, which presents a hazard if you have little ones running around. These are really first world problems, but what a convenience this controller is!
customer_reviews.author: B. Yamamoto

customer_reviews.title: Nope, nope, nope. Build a good product, and don't do dope.
customer_reviews.text: I read some other reviews and someone stated that readers should ignore all other negative reviews, what a jerk, just because you were lucky enough to get one that works doesn't mean that everyone else is stupid. I feel like I'm using a remote from the late 60s, early 70s and operates on a UHF/VHF radio frequency. I have to sit very close to the xbox, move the remote around like a puppet snake on qualudes and spout out colorful metaphors just to arrow up...or anything else I need to do. Sorry guys waw, waw, waaaaaaaw!
customer_reviews.author: Strimp

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: I wish I’d gotten one of these a while ago. I mostly game on my PC so my XBox is kind of a Netflix/Hulu/streaming machine. It got too annoying to navigate apps with the controller so I decided it was time to get a remote and it’s so worth it. It’s much easier to watch stuff, I don’t accidentally hit buttons on the controller and rewind or anything anymore. It didn’t come with instructions so if there’s a way to set it up so that you can use th volume buttons I don’t know how to do it, that’s the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: IR emitter must be pointed exactly straight
customer_reviews.text: The remote looks good, high quality. However, I thought it was broke in the first 5 minutes because the IR emitter is not 180 degree but more like 15 degree. I'm not able to bend my wrist in reverse to be able to point down from a chair to Xbox below the TV. Remote would work great for people with the Xbox ABOVE the tv. Big screw up of engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastien Tardif

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Original review below. It's been a month and I haven't heard back from this company. Customer service is either nonexistent or they are no longer in business. I do not recommend purchasing from them. I purchased this remote under a year ago and have had nothing but issues with it. About 6 months in the responsiveness has went downhill. I've used brand new batteries but it doesn't matter. You have to click buttons a bunch of times before they respond. It takes me forever to navigate with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ay

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for Xbox One. Nice backlight feature and clear buttons.
customer_reviews.text: I recently become cord cutter, cancelled my Dish service and wanted to use Xbox for Pluto TV, Netflix and OTA local channels. I am little disappointed that remote does not learn codes to control Vizio sound bar. I have tested all codes on the Internet without success. Maybe because It always adds "R' in front of code. It kinda makes this remote useless because I wanted to have all-in-one remote and not been able to control volume puts me back to have multiple remotes that I wanted to avoid in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: oldfart

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as promised
customer_reviews.text: Just pop in the batteries and it works on an X-Box One S exactly as promised. I bought it to make the BlueRay functionality behave after trying to use the game controller--that is a nightmare! This remote controls DVD and BlueRay playback like a "traditional" movie remote, very responsive scan forward, back, and pause. Buttons light up as soon as you move the remote, which is very handy in a dimly lit room. Also works with streaming apps. It's comfortable in the hand and responsive. Absolutely zero complaints! Does exactly what I wanted and I saved a few dollars versus the MS product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed ok. Not very ergonomic, just a flat rectangle which makes it more difficult to hold while trying to use the buttons with one hand while not looking at the unit. Now I also have to point it like I'm pointing a gun at the Xbox to get a response. Then I press the button (any button) and I may have to press it 2 or 3 times. Changed batteries thinking that might be the problem but it wasn't the answer. I'll be discarding this and looking for another remote as I'm past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Keffer

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT control your TV without kinect/IR transmitter
customer_reviews.text: They are adamant it will control your TV. It will NOT. It will only control your tv if you have a kinect or an IR blaster to send the signal from the xbox to the TV, aparently it was too complicated for them to make the remote control the TV directly (even though my Samsung Smart Watch can do it). To do it cheapest (and least creepy way(kinect camera hacks happen)) you need to buy a $15 IR "blaster" for your xbox. Other than that it does what it is supposed to. 2 stars for misleading and not properly clarifying their product requires an additional $169 in Microsoft hardware to work properly right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: John johns je

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I use my husband's xbox to watch movies/tv exclusively when he's at work and we would get into fights if I moved his controller or accidentally got it a little dirty. So this solves that problem, I have a remote and don't have to even think about his controllers and he's happy that his precious controllers aren't disturbed. My only complain is that you have to point it directly at the xbox for it to respond, other remotes have a bit more of a range to them, but it's not THAT big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda_Anne

customer_reviews.title: Puppy chewed original Xbox One Remote and this was an Excellent replacement
customer_reviews.text: We still use our Xbox One as a media center and console in one room. It's an all in one solution for TV, Media Center, Games etc. We mostly use the remote control. New pup chewed the original mini remote. I was skeptical about this one as a replacement, but it was the exactly replacement to the mini remote we originally got with the console, and it has a few more features. It's not going to control everything on earth, but if you do TV, Media Center, Soundbar, HDTV this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Halo

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with XBOX One (original) without added IR emitter
customer_reviews.text: It say all over the description, “controls tv.” But it does NOT! You have have an IR emitter to control an Xbox One original. The XBox One S/X and above have a built on IR emitter in the console. How hard would it be to add that information in the description or simply state Xbox one S and above, or (compatible Xbox One consoles with integrated IR emitter) granted its only a $6.00 part but I would have much rather ordered them together than try to figure it out, only to find it won’t work then order and wait on a second package. Very frustrating!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Great Media Remote for Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Was super tired of having so many remotes to watch TV (Stereo, TV, Xbox). I don't have a cable remote, but I have a hunch this would work well with a cable box too(if it doesn't work at all check your IR signal, may need blaster from Xbox to TV/Stereo/Cable box). Works with Xbox straight out of the box (uses IR technology). Back lit buttons work great, activate when remote is moved. Comes with A,B,X,Y, Home, Menu, Start, Back and App assignable OneGuide Buttons to name a few. Satin finish does seem a bit fragile, but still looks good after using daily for two months now. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danielsahn327

customer_reviews.title: Distance is a miss
customer_reviews.text: Great look and finish. Easy to use. But the distance for it to recognize when you push a button is very small. I am having to point straight at my xbox about 3-5 feet away for it to recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this
customer_reviews.text: Flaky device. Stopped responding to user inputs a few times now. First time I thought it was needing a change of batteries. And, I can't control anything other than the Xbox with it, it just doesn't like my TV or something. Back cover doesn't stay on. For a while it was fine, but as soon as I changed the batteries the cover just refuses to stay in place. Line of sight. And even then if you aren't aiming it just right.... I don't know what all the positive reviews are about. Payed shills? Because this thing is borderline junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Herold

customer_reviews.title: This thing is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviews are true. This thing is truly terrible. -- You have to point it directly at the Xbox. You can't be off even a few degrees. -- The buttons are horrid. You have to mash the center control buttons very hard and just right to get the command to register. -- Battery life is pretty bad too. Usually have to replace them every couple of weeks and we don't even use the remote that much. I'm looking for another option and will be throwing this thing away.
customer_reviews.author: Altered Steaks

customer_reviews.title: This works great!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the buttons went out on my original XBOX 1 remote. This is a great replacement, a bit longer, but the same construction. Funny the batteries that came with it were dead, but I have plenty of AAA batteries lying around, so that did not detract from the score at all. This works as well as the original remote, the buttons feel good to press with the same amount of pressure. We'll just see if this will last a few years like the original. So far very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ancron

customer_reviews.title: Looks GREAT, works TERRIBLY
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this remote. It LOOKS amazing and has a good feel in my hands. The only problem is that the buttons in the pic are REALLY unresponsive. It is a plastic pad and I have to punch the button multiple times before I hit the "Hot Spot" and then the xbox responds. I wanted to save my wireless controller with my xbox for gaming and not use up the batteries in my controller. So I bought this remote and it has been a big disappointment. I would save my money on this remote. There have got to be other good ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: SweetBeef

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10 and stupid proof
customer_reviews.text: 10 out of 10! I love this remote! I only use our xbox to watch tv unlike everyone else in the house I am not a gamer and have terrible time with the controller. I'm not tech savvy and the only thing I had to do was open the box, put the batteries in it and point it at the Xbox! Works with all our Xboxes and the hubs got it linked to the tv do it can control the volume as well! The button back light lights up when you touch the remote. Only thing I don't like is I wish the button back light stayed on a wee bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works but the buttons layout is almost unusable
customer_reviews.text: It worked out of the box with the XBOX One S. However, I really dislike the button layout. All this needs is big up,down,left,right and back buttons. Don't need x,y,a,b. I'd use the Xbox controller for that. All the other buttons are useless and make it very cluttered. The directional buttons, esp. right and left are very hard to push without flipping the remote in your hand. Torn whether to return or not but for $20 I think I'll keep it just to watch movies.
customer_reviews.author: Galileo

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it, it's so much better than other remotes!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best media remote for the XBox One. It's got that "soft-touch" feel like the Microsoft version, and the motion-activated backlighting looks nice. It seems like it's not IR - you don't have to be very close or even pointed directly at the Xbox for it to work. Best of all, it has ABXY buttons, which are used as shorcuts in many menus, including on-screen keyboards. This is a MUST HAVE, which the Microsoft version inexplicably doesn't have! All in all, I don't see how anyone who has an Xbox One could possibly not like this remote control!
customer_reviews.author: leftcoastfunk

customer_reviews.title: The good, the bad, the ugly...
customer_reviews.text: Good controller in that you won't need to keep turning your gaming controller on after every episode of a TV show. The bad, after about a month, the motion sensor backlighting stopped activating the backlighting. Fortunately, if I press any button the backlighting still activates. Another bad, the backlighting only stays on for about 2 seconds, and I have found no way to change the timer. I would want it to stay lite up for at least 5 seconds, if not more.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Best Xbox One Remote That Could Be Slightly Better
customer_reviews.text: Per other reviews, this is arguably the best remote you can get for the Xbox One. Improvements would be to lengthen the time the buttons light up when raising (a great feature for a home theater setup) and to add a non-IR solution. That's a pretty tall ask for the price, but I would pay more if it didn't require pointing the remote at the device. To that end, the range of the IR is pretty good, so even holding the remote perpendicular to the Xbox seems to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: No setup required but it goes through batteries like mad
customer_reviews.text: Agree with other reviews. It works right out of the box, just put in the batteries and go. No setup required, which is nice. It feels like it will hold up for a few years. *** update after owning the remote for 9 months. I'm changing my review from 5 stars to 1. Without any exaggeration I'm replacing the batteries every 2 weeks. The remote has a motion sensor that causes the buttons to light up any time you move the remote. It lights up from the slightest touch. My kids grip the remote in their hand anytime they watch tv so the thing is constantly lighting up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if you use your Xbox as your media center
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Useful, always on, comes with batteries, has backlighting, don't have to turn your dang Xbox controller on between episodes on Netflix because it does not time out, has the capabilities of a full controller and more, way cheaper than the official remote. Cons: Wish there was an option to make the backlighting stay on a second longer, it times out and dims too fast. Not worth giving up the 5 stars though, it really is that good especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kdont

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, faulty back.
customer_reviews.text: The remote itself works great! It’s so nice to not have to waste controller batteries while using Netflix or other apps. This is the second one I’ve purchased and both have issues with the back continuously falling off. After some use, the back won’t click into place and stay locked in. The back falls off. The batteries fall out. It’s irritating.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Essential for the Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I tried using a smaller knock off remote and it was terrible. Buttons wore off and it wasn't set up well. This remote is excellent! It lights up when it's moved, so you get a bice length of time to see buttons but not too long to be disturbing in darkness. Buttons are intuitive and easy to use. Works flawlessly! If you have an Xbox One you gotta get one of these (especially if you have a Kinect, then you can control everything)!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Spud

customer_reviews.title: Looks Better than it Works
customer_reviews.text: This remote looks and feels better than it works. First of all, if you don’t have Kinect you cannot use this with the base Xbox One. If you’ve put Kinect in the closet you’ll have to dig it out. It also won’t let you control your other components unless Kinect is connected. Once it’s set up it works, but button presses comstantly fail to register and adjusting the volume is way too slow. There’s no way to adjust it. You get what you pay for, but this remote should sell for 10 bucks max.
customer_reviews.author: LA Media Company

customer_reviews.title: Poor design with hard to use and dark buttons
customer_reviews.text: What seems like a cool thing with sleek buttons and a flat look turns out to be its downfall...the buttons are hard to find and harder to press. The buttons that should be lit aren't, making it hard to fumble and feel for the button you need. Poor decision on my part to pick this up as an XBox One remote. Only reason I gave it two stars...it does work. It's just a bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as a birthday gift for my husband, but I ended up using it the most. I hated having to use the XBOX controller for everything. When the controller was on it would almost always get accidentally touched while on, messing up movie time, or when I needed the controller, it would be shut off. This remote however, is super simple. All the buttons you need are on it. It automatically goes to sleep if still for a certain amount of time. But as soon as it is touched is back on immediately. Great purchase if you use XBOX for more things other than games.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I got this after deciding to cut the cord and only use Hulu, Netflix, & MLB.TV for my TV services. Using the game controllers was a real pain for fast forward, etc. This makes it so much better. You don't have to 'pair' it to your individual devices. You're only controlling the Xbox, which in turn controls the other things (TV & Sound Bar for me). The buttons have a nice feel to them, not cheap at all. My only little complaint is the backlight doesn't stay on very long. I find myself shaking it a little to get it to 'wake up' and light up. You won't be disappointed with this!
customer_reviews.author: NurseSh4rk

customer_reviews.title: I want to like this remote, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's been nearly a year since we purchased this. After 9 months, the remote started misbehaving. The right button now only works about half the time. Also, you have to change the batteries because there's no apparent way to disable the LED backlight, which we don't really need, and it chews through batteries more than it seemed to initially. Not sure what's happened. Looking for a different remote now, because this misbehavior has become super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but should use larger battery's
customer_reviews.text: It works great easy to setup to work with a TV and sound bar. We use are xbox mostly for media like Netflix and Hulu. The only thing I dislike is that the battery's don't last that long probably due to the fact that the remote lights up every time it's bumped which happens alot in my house. It doesn't work off of the same signal as the gaming controllers so if you have your Xbox recessed into a TV stand it doesn't work at certain angles, but does great if your in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: austin c.

customer_reviews.title: Great controller!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Xbox One controller! We canceled our cable about a month ago and have been watching Disney+ since on the XBox. The game controllers that come with the box are not convenient for controlling the streaming shows and movies so we ordered this one. Great decision! Controller is easy to use and very smooth to the touch which also allows for a nice grip too. So far no issues with it, will update the review as we use it more.
customer_reviews.author: BGWoman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sync with TV, but still has some benefits
customer_reviews.text: Not the real thing. It can't do some things an authentic Microsoft brand could do, but it does turn on as soon as you pick it up, which was my main problem with using the Xbox game controller. The remote lights up when you reach for it which helps you to see the buttons in the dark. You cannot sync it with your TV or sound bar, which would eliminate 2 of my 6 remotes! That's what I was hoping to be able to do. Seems well-made. Besides a lack of features, it's a good remote, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dot

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait soo long
customer_reviews.text: I have every streaming app I need with the exception of Apple TV+ installed on the xbox. This remote is a must have accessory that will make life easier. The backlit keyboard is a nice touch even makes it a no brainer for guest that aren't used to this remote. I rarely use my firestick anymore and since disconnected my stand alone Blu-ray player. I rate this remote 4 1/2 stars because one hand use can be a little tricky with the directional pad and the back button.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I like that i can use my video streaming apps without my controller because the controller would use up all of its batteries because the backlight is constantly on. With this the backlight turns off so it conservea battery power. When i got it, the volume function did work for my tv but that only lasted one day. To use the remote you cannot point it any direction. You jave to hunt to find the proper posistion and angle of the remote for it to work with the xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to keep my kids from damaging my controllers. It works as it should, it's light weight and comfortable in the hand and takes AAA batteries. The only two things I am dissatisfied with are that the "X" button is very easy to press when you mean to press the back button (which could entirely be my problem. The other thing is that the remote has to be pointed directly at the console in order for it to work. My xbox is in my entertainment center behind a glass door and if your pointing it from too far off to one side it doesnt pick up. Overall I would say 9/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C. Black

customer_reviews.title: Simple, straightforward function, and a good feel in the hand
customer_reviews.text: This remote is well worth the price based on initial unboxing and handling of the product. I didn't have to set anything up on my xbox, and all the buttons are responding. I have an xbox one s connected to a sony bravia 4k tv with android tv, and it can control volume on the tv and all xbox functions. I got this because I have most of my streaming services set up on my xbox, and the controller shutting off after a couple minutes of being idle gets annoying for pausing shows. This solves my issue and it feels like it's designed and produced by microsoft. It fits well next to my elite controller
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Mansch

customer_reviews.title: Broken Button after 1 Month
customer_reviews.text: This remote did work right out of the box. It looks like Xbox would have made it, it has the same feel as our smaller brand name remote. And we love the extra button options. BUT the pause/play button did stop working just over a month of using it. That’s a pretty important button. We’ll keep using it since the A button pauses most apps, but a button breaking a month in is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jklutts

customer_reviews.title: Falls short
customer_reviews.text: Great potential, but falls shorts. The remote control doesn't control the volume on my Samsung TV. The other thing is you have to point the remote control directly at the Xbox One to control it. If you don't point it directly at the Xbox One it can't detect the sensor. Weird because you don't have to do that with the Xbox One game controller. It doesn't matter which direction the game controller is pointed, the Xbox One will detect it. Not with this remote control, though.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for any Xbox
customer_reviews.text: It is great, way better then using a controller for movies. The backlight is motion activated but does not last long for a remote with so many buttons. Also some buttons don't actually work on most media. The Xbox Blu Ray player/4k player is software based and the remote tends to have issues with things like the CC (closed captioning) button. It has never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Huston

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This was initially a good purchase - half the cost of the Xbox official remote with more functionality. No complaints with it while it was working. Unfortunately, as some reviewers have alluded, it stopped working after about 18 months. Have never dropped it. The backlight still came on, however it would not signal/connect to the Xbox. I wonder if other positive reviewers have had it for at least that amount of time. And customer service at PDP is not good. Three customer service emails over 1 month ago (they state typical response within 5 business days) and a few calls and was unable to get a response
customer_reviews.author: Rex D Dancel

customer_reviews.title: Not a complete solution, but a nice remote
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviews point out, but which I failed to read until after this thing arrived, the remote itself will not control your TV's power or volume. Despite this being a feature available in some $5 remotes you get at a gas station or drug store, this remote lacks it. Instead, it requires a Kinect (which you can't even buy these days) or an IR blaster. Once I bought an IR blaster and put it on the TV, the remote is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Fluharty

customer_reviews.title: Great! Even for my unique setup.
customer_reviews.text: this remote works great. I connect my Xbox to my TV with an HDMI over Ethernet connection that also carries an IR signal. My Xbox is in my media closet. My Sonos beam is connected to my TV's audio output. I am able to control my Xbox via the IR-RX/TX and control the Sonos system volume with the remote. I wish the remote had a power button for the TV and that the XYAB buttons lit up like the other buttons. Otherwise this remote is great!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL product, stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Product was defective and wouldn't work with my Xbox One S but did manage to interefe with my soundbar by causing it to turn on and off when certain irrelevant buttons were pressed. The remote felt cheap and light, and rubber looks like it'll peel off easily. Troubleshooted for over an hour with Xbox, to no avail. Their customer service phone number did not work as it rang and no one picked up. Their website is a sham, with no support or community forum to help customers. Shady company, faulty products, and will never purchase from them again. I promptly returned this defective product for a refund. You have been warned!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bandak

customer_reviews.title: I should of bought one sooner I love it
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe I didn’t buy this a long time ago... it instantly syncs to your Xbox without having to do anything... super easy to program to your tv to adjust volume and what not with it... and the second you pick it up the buttons light up.. love the feel of it, it’s an awesome remote really glad I actually bought it and not having to use the actual controller anymore when watching Netflix or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: ChevyVortec350

customer_reviews.title: Works, but could use a few tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Works but not Bluetooth! You literally have to point it directly at the Xbox so it is kind of annoying in that way. Main button has a weird feel it should protrude from the remote, but instead it sinks in. Also weird lighting choice on the buttons. The main buttons used on Xbox controls should light up on the remove but they don’t. Hulu requires you to use the “X” button a lot, so it sucks when using. Overall we are fine with it we decided to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was good..... it isn’t.
customer_reviews.text: When the button inputs register, it works great. Used to have it in a cabinet and I would have to reach around to point right at it. Now my Xbox One is on top of my desk and still very easy for it to not register presses. I’m mashing the buttons. I change batteries often and it seems to help for awhile but quickly goes back to “remote gymnastics” trying to line it up and push the buttons multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for OTA TV and streaming on Xbox
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Xbox one X, I'm a cord cutter. Use the Xbox for watching OTA tv with the digital tuner fir the Xbox along with Netflix and Amazon Prime works great! No more Xbox controller going to sleep and turning it back on to pause a show. It also can control my LG sound bar for volume up and down. Like the back light on it, just wish it stayed on a little longer but not a problem. Nice feel to it also, seems well built.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Y

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST remote for you XBox
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different remote because I wanted to be cheap at first, but the thing had to be pointed right at my XBox with nothing obstructing the path. I ended up exchanging for this one, and I can point it almost anywhere and it works. That's VERY important for me. As well, it includes the XBOX controller buttons and it LIGHTS UP! Such an awesome remote. Every remote should be designed like this. My only wish is that it could control all my other devices. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: Ben Quiles

customer_reviews.title: Much better than controller
customer_reviews.text: Works well for running netflix, Disney+, etc. A few things I had questions about: -- This works for controlling the xbox WITHOUT a Kinect. I bought it and turned it on. works fine -- It will NOT control the TV volume and such without a Kinect or and IR repeater, but I don't have either. -- you do not turn it off and on, it is always on, and lights up when you pick it up. very nice. worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PTG

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this remote at least mine, you have to press so hard it creaks, also if your finger isn't placed in the right spot, nothing happens, & to cap it off if it's not pointed at the unit, zip, nothing. The up-down left and right pad are pretty recessed. Personally, I would not recommend or purchase again. I have a Sony 900e & cannot get the remote to sync with it. another strike.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with the Xbox One S and the Xbox One X. Highly recommend it! I use my Xbox one as my home entertainment system. I went into the Xbox settings and selected for it to turn on the TV and off The TV when the Xbox turns on or off. This remote is able to control volume and all the needed Xbox co trolls to play Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, and or Amazon Prime, when I am not playing video games.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: More Convenient Than Using Xbox Controller
customer_reviews.text: We use our Xbox just as much to watch TV as we do to play video games. This remote controller is a lot more convenient to use when we only want to watch TV or use random apps like YouTube. The remote synced up with our Xbox with ZERO effort at all. I only needed to put the batteries in and we were rolling right away. It fits well in your hand, it's light, and it works fine. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Number One Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features but finnicky buttons lead to frustrating usage
customer_reviews.text: I got this remote because my brother moved out and took his official Xbox one remote with him. I had used that remote for years with no issues. I ordered this one and immediately noticed the difference. In the beginning, most of the presses on the navigation pad worked well but after 5 months of use, I find myself mashing the buttons to try and get them to work. I mostly only use this remote for volume now since it's so much easier to navigate with a controller. I've tried changing batteries and I have a clear line of sight to the Xbox from wherever I sit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Woolum

customer_reviews.title: Needs quality control
customer_reviews.text: Update: 3months in and the remote has stopped working. I thought it was the batteries because the volume buttons weren't working, but after getting new batteries in it, the remote just gave up all together. The overall design is highly appealing and modern. Does a great job in controlling my Xbox for YouTube and movies. Coupled with an IR sensor/blaster, I am able to control my TV volume and power also. The only thing I'd change is to have the Xbox button light up, the same way the original controller does, as well as the A B X and Y buttons.
customer_reviews.author: tymarbry

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Remote won't last long
customer_reviews.text: I have less than 1 year with this remote and it has stopped working. The touch sensitive lights sputter when operating. This remote lives in my bedroom, I have no kids so there is no way this remote has received any user abuse. This remote probably does not come with a warranty . Please don't tell me to change the batteries because I switched fresh batteries in and even then it fails to connect to the desired devices. Despite all this it used to be an awesome remote, but it gets 1 star because of longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Villalobos

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected (update)
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at the high quality feel of this remote. For $20, it’s a very nice product. Controlled the volume of my Sony TV right out of the box! Perfect for the Xbox. If you are looking for an Xbox media remote, look no further. Glad I went with this over the official Xbox media remote. Update: I’ve had it for almost a year now. Still works great. If the batteries are too low it will be a little unresponsive. It has a motion sensor that turns on the backlighting so it’s gonna use a bit of battery power to illuminate everything.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Early

customer_reviews.title: Great features and quality remote.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely buy this remote. For what I paid I was not expecting it to work as well as the Microsoft controller. It works just as good. Point and press. Boom all the functions work great. I watch tv via the Xbox one and the remote is a huge help as the gaming controller for this function was super awkward. Now it’s just like another tv remote. Works perfectly and feels like a quality remote. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E. Freiling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent remote. I recently started using my xbox one x for my main media machine. I have it going through my Sony 7.2 receiver for Dolby Atmos and it controls the volume. The remote itself has a nice matte texture to it with many buttons and are backlit when picked up. No problems at all, works perfectly with no hickups. Has pretty great range as well. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: wes53177

customer_reviews.title: Volume control very inconsistent - unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: I had this remote for several weeks and it was working fine with my slightly older Vizio 4k TV. However, since having to get a new TV, this remote now doesn't work with volume control almost every time I try to use it. It is extremely inconsistent and I am sometimes surprised to see it actually working, but the VAST majority of the time, the volume control does not work at all. Almost perfect, but this is a big, big issue that really negates just about all other potential utility of this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Martin

customer_reviews.title: Two faithful years
customer_reviews.text: Have had this remote almost two years and it just recently quit working. It's been super helpful in the meantime. Originally bought it so that my daughter would be able operate the streaming apps. Wound up using all the time except when gaming and saving on batteries for the controller. Super sad it's done for considering ordering again but judging from more recent reviews may have to look into other options first
customer_reviews.author: Trenna_Jay

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful! Bought it as Christmas present for my boyfriend, but it also makes it a lot easier for me to navigate his Xbox 1 since I’m not accustomed to the game controller. We love that the buttons light up when you lift it (perfect when you’re watching Netflix in the dark), and the whole remote has a very sleek look and feel. Cheaper than the “official” version I saw for something like $48, and seems to have more options/functionality to boot. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super handy if you stream with your Xbox
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to find a regular remote for our Xbox. It has an instant set up, like literally press the power button and it's connected. It's the size of a regular remote. It lights up when you move it so you can see the buttons in the dark. One thing that has to be specially set up is the volume which I haven't had the time to do yet, but all I have to do is go into the xbox settings.
customer_reviews.author: Tabconn

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent remote
customer_reviews.text: Second best accessory you can get for your Xbox. A decent headset being the first, of course. Once you can no look the controller type buttons it’s so awesome. The backlighting is phenomenal! Comes on with the quickness for quick reference.
customer_reviews.author: The Ben

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best remote for the Xbox and best bang for the buck savings
customer_reviews.text: The remote works very well! Great substitute instead of spending a lot more then the regular Xbox remote UPDATE: AFTER A COUPLE OF MONTHS IT STOPPED WORKING, I used this remote alot and it stopped working, I tried changing the battery's but the remote lights turn on but spazzes out my Xbox with clicking and scrolling. I really wish it last like a normal remote, now im looking for other ways to get a remote for my xbox
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as it should. I have a Samsung TV, this remote synced up automatically. The remote power button turns both the Xbox and TV on and off. When it turns on - after the Xbox turns on and has booted up - then the TV turns on, about 15 seconds later. The TV turns off only a few seconds after the power button is pressed. I love that I no longer need to wait for the controller to power back on so I could pause what I'm watching before answering an incoming call!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to Xbox One entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this remote to make watching content on the Xbox easier, without fumbling over a controller. Having the cable box hooked up to the Xbox, plus all the streaming and music apps, my living room Xbox was used for quite a lot more than gaming. As long as you have line of sight with the Xbox and set top boxes either as they are or with IR blasters, this remote controls it all. Stylish and sleek, and with a light up function when you pick up there remote compliment any decor and make it easier to use. Recommended for anyone using the Xbox One for watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This remote is fantastic. Extra tip of the hat for including the ABXY buttons. With IR blaster cables in place, it works TV volume also, so if you're streaming, this is the only remote you need. Two minor quibbles: the volume is slow to ramp up/down, and the back light only stays on for a second or two, which is an annoyance until you memorize the button layout. Overall, solid 4 of 5 rating IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe McGonnell

customer_reviews.title: High-quality, well-designed remote. Feels great in the hand.
customer_reviews.text: Since Microsoft discontinued their own Xbox One media remote, I’ve finally found a worthy replacement. This Xbox One remote from PDP Talon is really well made, with a soft texture that feels great in the hand, and all the features I want in a remote control for the Xbox One. The momentary backlighting is also a very nice touch, when operating the remote in a dark room. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Denster2u

customer_reviews.title: Forget Microsoft! Buy this! DO IT FOR THE BUTTONS! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the Microsoft version. Hands down. You won't regret this. If anything...if you're streaming cable television or dish/direct-tv etc. IF you have a cable box of any sorts - run that HDMI cable from the back of it to your Xbox One and OWN your One Guide app with this remote. DO IT FOR THE NUMBERED and A, Y, X & B buttons!! They're life savers!!! The look, the feel of this remote is freaking amazing! LOVE IT! Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for streamers
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid remote. I have only used it with the Xbox, no receivers or TVs, but I like it so far. I agree with some commenters that the directional buttons take a bit of pressure, which wouldn’t be a problem, but it’s hard to feel if you’re pushing the right spot on the circle. It would also be nice if the A,B,X,Y buttons would light up with movement, but the fact that the rest do still makes them easy to find. I like that the play/pause buttons work with streaming video.
customer_reviews.author: J. Step

customer_reviews.title: much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works well even when Xbox is not directly in front of the remote. My Xbox is 15 feet away and off to the left of the screen. The balance of the remote is good. The backlight is the right brightness. The buttons all work very smoothly. Much easier to use than the game controller. Nice to have all of the media buttons grouped together. Very happy I purchased this remote.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bresnahan

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want to get an fancy or expensive remote. We cancelled our direct t.v. and the company wanted their remote back and so we got this. It's been working well so far. Sometimes when the tv is turned left and I'm guessing doesn't align with the xbox, the volume work catch(hence minus one star). But whatever, not that big a deal. We just don't let the kids handle it. Connection was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Claudina

customer_reviews.title: Backlight went from not staying on long enough to not working at all
customer_reviews.text: The good -Works with the Xbox One S The bad -Button back lights never stayed on long enough to make a selection, then in less that three months quit working all together.
customer_reviews.author: CascadianAaron

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years In
customer_reviews.text: Its been over two years now since I got this remote. At first, it was like Christmas in July, now its a constant game of hide and seek. The back part broke about 3 months after I got it, poor design to have a 1/8 of an inch slide to get to the battery compartment. Now it just freely comes on and off. The buttons in the circle are getting harder and harder to push making my "normal" remote grip more difficult. Never had a problem with connection issues so thats a plus, and it does actually feel very good. Doesnt eat through batteries which is good also. Will be buying a different remote in the future
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly, great price
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it needs to do and nothing it doesn't. Great looking and feeling remote, with the added shiny perk of lighting up when you pick it up. I use my Xbox One X more than my PS4 right now, and it's a pain to constantly be turning the controller back on when playing media. Linking the remote was stupid easy, it automatically links to whatever Xbox is on in the room, so when I sold my OG Xbox One and bought my X, there was no need to re-link the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this remote!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I really just hate using the controller to use Netflix and my Science Go app. It works perfectly and it lights up when you touch it. One quirk I found that I actually enjoy that others may not is that it controls both my xbox and my boyfriends at the same time. Makes it fun to mess with him, lol. I would just be careful if you do have multiple xbox's, as it will probably try to control it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Remote has a great design feel comfortable in the hand easy to use really like the auto backlight feature and did not even need to go through the pain in the ass of trying to connect it to the Xbox worked with no issues right out of the box just popped the batteries in and off I went. I love how it also has twice the features of the Xbox version and dose not feel like a cheap piece of plastic like the Xbox One does.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A great media remote option for your xbox one.
customer_reviews.text: As a owner of a Harmony remote who cracked its screen, the idea of plopping down another $150+ for a harmony gave me pause espcially considering my cable runs through my xbox one. It dawned on me that the xbox at this point acts very much like a harmony and perhaps there is a cheaper option. Enter this remote. Honestly, if you are in the market for a media remote look no further. The one negative I have is the light turns off very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bailey

product_meta.title: PDP 048-083-NA Talon Media Remote Control for Xbox One, TV, Blu-Ray & Streaming Media
product_meta.description: Easily control your Xbox One system with the convenient officially licensed Talon Media Remote for Xbox One. Want quick and simple access to all your favorite movies, TV shows, music, and videos, as well as Complete control of channel and volume for your TV? Coordinate your system with the Talon Media Remote and stay in charge right from the comfort of your couch. With motion activated backlit buttons, a soft rubberized texture, and D pad/A, B, X, Y button control, you’ll have everything you need for a Complete Xbox One experience.
feature_bullets: Multipurpose remote controls your Xbox One system, TV, Blu ray and Streaming media applications
Soft rubberized texture with TV controls, (volume, channel, mute) D pad, A,B,X,Y, and numeric buttons control
Motion activated backlighting helps you locate buttons in the dark
Officially licensed by Microsoft; Electronics general compatibility: Video game consoles
